response_requirements.initial_response_description: Written requests must receive response within 10 business days; records should be made available 'as soon as practicable'
response_requirements.final_response_notes: No specific statutory deadline beyond 10 business day written response requirement; records available 'as soon as practicable'

fee_structure.search_fee_notes: May charge for staff time in excess of one hour
fee_structure.copy_fee_notes: Actual cost of reproduction; actual cost of mailing or transmission
fee_structure.fee_waiver_criteria: Fees may be waived or reduced if disclosure would be in the public interest

exemptions.description: Trade secrets and proprietary commercial information that would unfairly harm competitive position
Correspondence, memoranda, and working papers of officials; personal records or documents

appeal_process.first_level_notes: File notice of review with Office of Hearing Examiners for administrative review of denial or excessive fees
appeal_process.second_level_notes: Civil action may be filed within 90 days of denial; court may award costs if agency acted unreasonably
appeal_process.attorney_fees_notes: Court may award costs if agency acted unreasonably

requester_requirements.residency_notes: Both citizens and non-citizens may request records
requester_requirements.request_format_notes: Written requests recommended for formal proceedings; no specific form required
requester_requirements.specific_format: No statement of purpose required; no restrictions on use of records

agency_obligations.response_format_options: Records available for inspection as soon as practicable
agency_obligations.liberal_construction: Presumption that all public records are accessible (reversed from pre-2009 confidentiality presumption)

oversight_body.name: Office of Hearing Examiners
oversight_body.role: Administrative review of denials and fee disputes

primary_sources: South Dakota Codified Laws Title 1, Chapter 27
validation_metadata.verification_notes: All fields verified from official South Dakota statute. Written requests receive response within 10 business days; records available 'as soon as practicable'. Staff time charges after first hour. Fee waivers available if in public interest. Administrative review via Office of Hearing Examiners; circuit court action within 90 days. 2009 reform reversed confidentiality presumption - now presumed public unless exempted. Both citizens and non-citizens may request.
